engine_version: 3.9 -- 'Opportunity First' cycle: Manufacturing (31-33) + Micro-Firm emerging category deep dives, 22 new model cards (12 manufacturing + 10 micro-firm), 44 signals, 38 CLA refinements applied to mid-tier models, P-041 Manufacturing Modernization Bimodality candidate pattern, 435 models rated (413→435), first physical economy deep dive, first emerging category deep dive. Dual ranking active with expanded manual CLA overrides (49→87).

key_metrics.humanoid_robots: China 90% global market — Unitree 5,500 shipped, AgiBot 5,168 shipped, exceeding Tesla target. Tesla Optimus Gen 3 mass production launched Jan 21 but 'no useful work' yet (Musk Jan 28)
key_metrics.open_source_gap: DeepSeek V4 expected ~Feb 17 with Engram memory, targeting Opus 4.5 SWE-bench parity. Open-proprietary lag approaching real-time
key_metrics.ai_coding: 25-40% of Google code AI-generated BUT experienced devs 19% SLOWER on complex tasks (perception-reality gap). Gains concentrated in narrow workflows (20-30%)
key_metrics.fda_ai_devices: 1,250+ cumulative. FDA DEREGULATED AI clinical decision support Jan 6, 2026 — AI single-recommendation CDS exempt from device regulation
key_metrics.enterprise_adoption: 78% (McKinsey), 95% GenAI (Bain). $37B GenAI spending 2025 (3.2x YoY). But EBIT impact still rare. Shift to disciplined deployment (fewer licenses, higher spend/license)
key_metrics.ai_agents: OpenAI Frontier enterprise agent platform launched Feb 5. Claude Opus 4.6 agent teams (multi-agent parallel decomposition). Frontier capability unlocked.
key_metrics.nvidia_backlog: 3.6M Blackwell units, $500B orders through 2026, GPU cabinets 28K→60K+. CoWoS/HBM multi-year shortage
key_metrics.anticipatory_displacement: HBR: 60% of orgs reduced headcount anticipating AI, only 2% tied to actual AI implementation. Companies acting on potential, not performance
key_metrics.maven_ai: DoD Maven targeting 100% machine-generated intel by mid-2026
key_metrics.chinese_ai_spring: 5 Chinese labs launched frontier models simultaneously (Feb 2026): GLM-5 (Zhipu), MiniMax M2.2, Doubao 2.0 (ByteDance), Qwen 3.5 (Alibaba), Kimi K2.5 (Moonshot). China AI ecosystem is self-sustaining — export controls cannot create single point of failure
key_metrics.triple_frontier_launch: Claude Opus 4.6 + GPT-5.3-Codex + Gemini 3 all launched Feb 5 — unprecedented simultaneous frontier release. Multi-agent orchestration now shipped product from all 3 labs
key_metrics.moltbook_breach: Moltbook data breach = first frontier-model prompt injection exploit in production. AI security infrastructure demand confirmed.

F1_technology.direction: v3-9: Physical constraints now binding AI scaling (15 GW data center leased but 0 online, 2,600 GW interconnection queue). Robotics funding surged 77% YoY to $13.8B. Enterprise AI shifted from pilot to agent-mode (5% → 40%). Manufacturing deep dive confirms 78-point implementation gap (98% exploring, 20% ready). Micro-firm AI OS category emerging — AI agent teams replacing 10-15 human roles.

key_metrics.us_silver_tsunami: 52.3% of employer businesses owned by 55+, 2.34M businesses. $68T total boomer wealth transfer by 2030 including $5.1T in small business value. 12M businesses changing hands this decade.
key_metrics.succession_gap: 58% have no succession plan, 70% never successfully sell
key_metrics.japan_population: Declining ~919K/yr, sub-670K births 2025 (new record low). $22.3B annual family spending from FY2026
key_metrics.china_births: 7.92M in 2025 (-17% YoY), comparable to 1738 levels. Women 20-34 declining from 105M to 58M by 2050 — irreversible
key_metrics.us_labor_market: Jan 2026 BLS: +130K jobs (healthcare +82K dominates). BUT 898K DOWNWARD REVISION to 2025 employment. JOLTS plunged to 6.54M (0.87 jobs/worker — reversal from 2+ in 2022). Market restructuring, not collapsing.
key_metrics.college_enrollment_cliff: 15% decline projected 2025-2029, up to 80 additional closures, 400 total possible this decade. 5 states = 75% of decline (IL, CA, NY, PA, MI). $18B endowment redistribution
key_metrics.h1b_impact: $100K fee crystallizing: startups 10-20% of revenue, IT services $500M+. Wage-weighted lottery effective Feb 27, 2026. 2 major lawsuits filed
key_metrics.entry_level_collapse: 67% drop in junior developer hiring 2024-2026. 35% all entry-level decline (Revelio Labs). 37% managers prefer AI over Gen Z hire. Only 7% of 2024 hires were recent grads
key_metrics.trades_shortage: 499K new workers needed in building trades (2026)
key_metrics.pipeline_collapse: CPA -33%, nursing 78K->200K, teaching 42 states (411K vacant), trucking age 57
key_metrics.india_dividend: 1.44B population, 1B working-age, median 28. Zero-tax-through-2047 for AI. $70-100B hyperscaler commitments
key_metrics.healthcare_monoculture: Jan 2026: healthcare = 95% of net job creation (137K of 143K). Trailing 3-month: 54.1% of all private jobs. US becoming healthcare employment monoculture
key_metrics.bls_revision_shock: 898K downward revision (largest since 2009). Combined with prior 818K = 1.7M jobs overstated. 2024 economy materially weaker than reported
key_metrics.h1b_binary_event: Wage-weighted lottery effective Feb 27. 55% self-selection expected. Indian IT services body-shop model structurally disadvantaged
key_metrics.negative_net_migration: CBO: net migration -295K to +10K (2025-2034 window). Combined with BLS 898K revision = labor market far weaker than believed.
key_metrics.construction_wage_inflation: 6-8% trade wage inflation, especially HVAC/electrical/plumbing. 499K new workers needed.
key_metrics.silver_tsunami_value: $10T total intergenerational asset transfer. Manufacturing deep dive: machinist median age 57, machine shop avg 15.9 workers.

F2_demographics.direction: v3-9: Three simultaneous demographic shocks confirmed: (1) negative net migration (-295K to -10K), (2) BLS 1.7M cumulative overstatement, (3) Silver Tsunami $10T total transfer. Manufacturing most affected: machinist median age 57, 392K establishments with extreme fragmentation (avg 32.8 workers). Construction 6-8% wage inflation. 'Job hugging' phenomenon (64% staying put) reduces labor mobility.

key_metrics.us_china_tariffs: 47.5% avg US tariff on China (100% coverage). Nov 2025 truce through Nov 10, 2026 at risk — Iran 25% tariff threatens destabilization
key_metrics.eu_ai_act: Digital Omnibus delays high-risk Annex III from Aug 2026 to Dec 2027 (16mo). Conditional on standards readiness. Creates regulatory uncertainty window
key_metrics.rearm_europe: EUR 800B ReArm Europe/Readiness 2030 — 1.5% GDP fiscal escape clause (EUR 650B), EUR 150B SAFE loans. Drones and air defense prioritized
key_metrics.india_ai: Zero taxes on cloud/AI revenues through 2047. $70-100B from Google/Amazon/Microsoft. AI Impact Summit Feb 16-20 (first Global South). 9.2 GW data center target by 2030
key_metrics.aukus: Pillar II autonomous warfare trials expanding 2026. AI models proven interoperable across US/UK/Australia platforms
key_metrics.china_chips: 3 new AI chip fabs by late 2026, 80% domestic demand capture target. 25% US 'security tariff' on chip exports. Busan 1-year suspension
key_metrics.gulf_ai: $200B+ combined Saudi/UAE. HUMAIN deploying 18,000 GB300s. UAE Stargate 1GW cluster (G42/OpenAI/Oracle/Nvidia/SoftBank). Positioning as neutral compute hub in US-China bifurcation
key_metrics.defense_spending: $2,750B global defense (9.4%+ YoY). NATO 5% GDP target. DoD $961.6B base + $150B reconciliation. $13.4B AI/autonomy line
key_metrics.us_ai_regulation: Trump EO creates AI Litigation Task Force vs 280 bipartisan state lawmakers. Federal preemption uncertain — EO cannot overturn state law. March 11 Commerce/FTC deadlines imminent
key_metrics.cmmc_enforcement: CMMC 2.0 enforcement begins, 220K+ DIB companies must certify
key_metrics.doge_federal_cuts: DOGE: federal workforce -322K (lowest since 1966). DC/VA/MD regional restructuring accelerating.
key_metrics.critical_minerals: Critical Minerals Ministerial: 54 nations, FORGE alliance, $10B Project Vault, 30-day stockpile commitment
key_metrics.aukus_itar: AUKUS ITAR exemption reduces defense tech export friction for AU/UK

F3_geopolitics.direction: v3-9: DOGE federal cuts (-322K, lowest since 1966) creating regional economic restructuring. Critical Minerals Ministerial (54 nations, $10B Project Vault) formalizes resource geopolitics. India AI Summit executing. US-China tariffs at 47.5%. AUKUS ITAR exemption opens defense tech export corridor.

key_metrics.fed_funds: 3.50-3.75% (Jan 2026 hold). 2 FOMC dissents favoring cut. Futures: at most 2 cuts in 2026, ZERO in 2027. Higher-for-longer structural
key_metrics.cre_cmbs: Office CMBS delinquency 12.3% (near all-time record). Corporate bankruptcy 14-year high (694).
key_metrics.ai_mega_rounds: Anthropic $20B at $350B (doubled in 5mo). OpenAI $100B at $830B. xAI $20B at $230B. Humans& $480M seed at $4.48B. Total Jan-Feb 2026 frontier raises >$140B
key_metrics.defense_tech: $17.9B equity funding 2025 (2.45x YoY). Exits record $54.4B (3x YoY). Nvidia/Groq $20B. 41% more active defense investors. Exits > investment = Deployment phase signal
key_metrics.pe_distress: Bankruptcies trending up early 2026. Most exposed: retail, dining, RE, energy, healthcare, education. PE dry powder positioning for aggressive middle-market M&A. Private credit as dominant distress liquidity source
key_metrics.sp500_concentration: Top 10 = 40% of index weight (all-time record). Forward P/E 22x (matches 2021 peak). But Mag 7 earnings share declining to 31% — broadening
key_metrics.vc_2026: 10-25% funding increase expected. AI + robotics + defense gaining share. Climate, crypto, undifferentiated AI losing. Secondaries becoming mainstream liquidity
key_metrics.defense_tech_doubled: Defense tech $49B (doubled YoY). IPO pipeline: Anthropic $350B, OpenAI, SpaceX $1.5T

F4_capital.direction: v3-9: Capital BIFURCATING: AI/defense accelerating ($49B defense tech, doubled YoY) while CRE/office in crisis (CMBS 12.3%, bankruptcy 14-year high at 694). Fed hold at 3.5-3.75%. IPO pipeline forming (Anthropic $350B, SpaceX $1.5T). Manufacturing PE dry powder targeting Silver Tsunami acquisitions at 3-5x EBITDA.

key_metrics.worker_fear: ESCALATED: 60% expect AI to cut more jobs than it adds (from 40% in v3-4). 51% worried about own job. 1 in 5 knows someone who lost job to AI — fear transitioning from abstract to experiential
key_metrics.ai_washing_layoffs: 108,435 Jan 2026 job cuts (+118% YoY). HBR: 60% orgs cut headcount anticipating AI, only 2% tied to actual implementation. 'Forever layoffs' amid profits
key_metrics.entry_level_extinction: 67% junior dev hiring collapse. 37% managers prefer AI over Gen Z. 35% all entry-level decline. Pipeline destruction with decade-lag leadership consequences
key_metrics.k_shaped_sentiment: Michigan 57.3 (6-mo high). 7-point gap: wealthy (stock-driven) vs hourly workers. Spending strong despite low confidence — behavioral decoupling
key_metrics.deepfake_trust_collapse: Europol: 90% of online content may be synthetic by 2026. 8M deepfakes 2025 (16x from 2023). 'Liar's Dividend' — authentic content dismissed as fake
key_metrics.enterprise_roi: $37B GenAI spent 2025 (3.2x). 66% productivity gains. But enterprise-wide EBIT rare. Fewer licenses, higher spend — disciplined deployment
key_metrics.education_fear: Brookings: AI risks outweigh benefits for children (50-country study). Ohio mandates AI frameworks by Jul 2026. Michigan proposes chatbot liability for minors. Alpha School parents report child anxiety
key_metrics.state_regulation_wave: 2026 bills target NEW categories: agentic AI, algorithmic pricing, chatbot liability for minors. Colorado AI Act effective 2026. Liability shifting from governance to outcomes
key_metrics.generational_divide: Gen Z 67% excited vs Boomers 29% excited / 51% worried. Boomer confidence dropped 35%
key_metrics.usage_confidence_gap: ManpowerGroup: AI usage +13% but confidence -18%. Gartner: GenAI enters Trough of Disillusionment.
key_metrics.deepfake_fraud: $12.5B deepfake fraud losses in 2025. 1,200 state AI bills across 38 states.
key_metrics.job_hugging: 'Job hugging' phenomenon: 64% of workers staying put despite dissatisfaction. Voluntary turnover collapsing.

F5_psychology.direction: v3-9: Fear friction WIDENING: AI usage up but confidence down simultaneously (ManpowerGroup +13%/-18%). 78% deploy AI but only 23% measure ROI (adoption-measurement gap). GenAI in Gartner Trough. Deepfake fraud $12.5B. 1,200 state AI bills. 'Job hugging' (64%) reduces labor mobility. Enterprise ROI skepticism growing.

key_metrics.data_center_electricity: IEA: doubling to 945 TWh global by 2030. US: 133% growth to 426 TWh. AI servers growing 30%/yr (4x other sectors). Occupancy 95%+ peak late 2026
key_metrics.grid_bottleneck: 2,600 GW in queue, 5+ year wait — THE binding constraint on AI scaling
key_metrics.pjm_capacity: $16.4B auction (3rd consecutive record). Price at $333/MW-day CAP. Data centers 63% of price increase. 8+ year queue wait
key_metrics.zero_water_cooling: Microsoft piloting zero-water-evaporation cooling in Phoenix and Wisconsin (2026). Trades water for energy — resource substitution
key_metrics.copper: Conflicting: ICSG 150K deficit vs Red Cloud 126K surplus (tariff demand destruction). Citi $13-15K/tonne. Long-term: 766K deficit by 2030. DC demand 330-500K tonnes/yr by 2030
key_metrics.renewable_policy: One Big Beautiful Bill terminates residential solar credit Dec 2025. Wind/solar phase-out for construction after Jul 2026. Solar LCOE still competitive ($38-78/MWh) but 15-30% more expensive without credits
key_metrics.nuclear_renaissance: 10GW+ committed for AI (TMI restart, Kairos SMR, Talen). QCEW: nuclear employment (38K workers) at Baumol 2.22
key_metrics.solar_growth: Solar electric (221114) employment +51.6% YoY — fastest-growing sub-sector in entire QCEW dataset
key_metrics.water_stress: 1.7B gallons/day for data center cooling globally. Microsoft zero-water pilot is first hyperscaler response
key_metrics.data_center_gap: 15 GW data center leased but NONE online. Supply-demand gap widening.
key_metrics.meta_nuclear: Meta 6.6 GW nuclear deal (largest single-company commitment in US history)
key_metrics.smr_progress: Holtec SMR-300 NRC application filed (first post-NuScale). 2,600 GW interconnection queue.
key_metrics.copper_record: Copper $13,387/tonne (record). CA water stress: 116B liters for data centers by 2028.
key_metrics.obbba_deadline: OBBBA renewable credit deadline Jul 5, 2026 — creates construction rush then cliff

F6_energy.direction: v3-9: Physical constraints now BINDING AI scaling. 15 GW leased, 0 online. Meta 6.6 GW nuclear (largest ever). Holtec SMR-300 application. Copper at $13,387/tonne record. 2,600 GW interconnection queue. OBBBA renewable deadline Jul 5, 2026 creates rush-then-cliff dynamic. Water stress intensifying (CA 116B liters by 2028).

sector_transformations.evidence_summary: v3-6: Office CMBS 12.34% (all-time record, above 2008). CRE cascade chain validated. 3 new FS model cards scored (5239-001: 78.75, 5223-001: 78.5, 5239-002: 71.25). Mortgage servicing most extreme labor signal: 13.8% wage growth AND -10.7% employment simultaneously. RIA sector (523940) has 496K workers at $270K avg and extreme fragmentation — identified by sector screener as next FS deep-dive target.

v3-6: 5 new model cards scored across sub-sectors (5415-001: 70.75, 5417-001: 69.5, 5417-002: 64.75, 5413-001: 68.5, 5416-001: 63.75). Legal services (5411) has highest fear friction of any professional sector at 82% ethical concern. IT services (5415) is self-disrupting: 2.46M workers, AI coding 19% SLOWER for experienced devs. Sector screener identifies 5415 as standalone deep-dive candidate.

v3-9 DEEP DIVE (first ever): 12.87M workers, 392K establishments, $82,575 avg pay, $1.06T total wages. Baumol 1.14x (moderate — transformation is ADDITIVE not substitutional). 6 sub-sectors analyzed: Food (311: 1.73M emp, Baumol 0.82, robot orders +85.6%), Fabricated Metal (332: 1.44M emp, most fragmented at 60.7K establishments), Machinery (333: 1.18M emp, CNC/digital twin frontier), Computer/Electronic (334: 1.06M emp, CHIPS Act driven), Transportation Equipment (336: 1.88M emp, EV transition + reshoring), Plastics (326: 600K emp, classic Baumol release -2.1% emp/+4.1% wages). P-041 candidate: Manufacturing Modernization Bimodality (top 1% AI-sophisticated, bottom 72% on spreadsheets). Manufacturing is MOST ACTIONABLE sector: extreme fragmentation + demographic pressure + proven cobot tech + reshoring tailwind + low fear friction + ADDITIVE transformation. 12 new model cards, 3 WIDE_OPEN, 9 ACCESSIBLE. Avg Transformation 77.8, avg Opportunity 69.4.

v3-8 DEEP DIVE: 21.3M workers, 1.9M establishments, +4.5% employment growth. Healthcare monoculture (P-039) confirmed — 63% of Jan 2026 jobs. QCEW sub-sector data: Hospitals (622) 5.27M emp +3.7%, Ambulatory (621) 8.44M emp +4.1%, Nursing/Residential (623) 3.15M emp +5.5%, Social Assistance (624) 4.41M emp +5.6%. Nursing 8% national deficit, 250K RN gap by 2030. FDA AI deregulation + invisible pathway (admin→clinical). 34-pt provider-patient trust gap. PE record $190B+ deal value. Counter-signals: aging demographics create non-discretionary demand (95% seniors have 1+ chronic condition), monoculture may be structurally sustainable not fragile. 12 new model cards from deep dive.
v3-6: Staffing canary continues — sector screener confirms structural collapse. UPS cut 30K (Amazon split). Entry-level hiring collapse (-67% junior devs) further undermines staffing model viability.
Jan 2026 BLS: construction +33K. Data center construction driving demand. 70 GW solar deployment rush before Jul 2026 credit expiration. AEC design card (5413-001) scored 68.5.
Zero-density Schumpeterian gap persists. US-China tariff truce at risk could disrupt trade flows.

UPGRADED early_disruption→acceleration (v3-6). 8 defense cards scored (avg 74.8, highest batch). MC-DEF-011 CMMC at 82.5 is strongest new card. Defense tech exits $54.4B (3x YoY) > investment ($49.1B) = first AI sector in Deployment phase. ReArm Europe EUR 800B. AUKUS autonomous warfare interoperability proven. Counter-UAS $7.5B budget. Nvidia/Groq $20B validates defense-AI hardware convergence.

v3-6: 8 education cards scored (avg 68.9, lowest batch due to fear friction). Brookings 50-country study confirms AI risks outweigh benefits for children. Ohio mandates AI frameworks by Jul 2026. Michigan chatbot liability for minors. Fear economy card (EDU-FEAR-01: 72.25) confirms fear creates market. College cliff NOW: 400 schools could close this decade, $18B endowment redistribution, 5 states = 75% of decline.

sector_transformations.sector_name: Computer Systems Design and Related Services (IT Services)
sector_transformations.evidence_summary: v3-7 deep dive: 2.46M workers, $366.8B payroll, Baumol 2.05x. Custom programming (541511) = 1.11M workers at $164K, highest direct AI substitution potential. 84% of developers using AI coding daily. BUT experienced devs 19% SLOWER on complex tasks. Employment flat (-0.4%) while wages +5% = classic Baumol squeeze onset. Extreme fragmentation (405K establishments, avg 6.1 workers). AI consulting growing 26-36% CAGR to $116B by 2035 even as traditional IT services compress.

v3-7 deep dive: 2.55M workers, $375B payroll, Baumol 2.02x. This is the COMMAND AND CONTROL layer — corporate HQ, holding companies, regional offices. 55% routine-cognitive (reporting, budgets, status aggregation). Gartner: 20% of orgs eliminating >50% of middle management by 2026. McKinsey cutting 10% workforce. Coasean coordination cost collapse: when AI collapses coordination cost, this sector's rationale weakens. Employment projected to decline from 2.55M to 2.0-2.2M by 2031.

sector_transformations.sector_name: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
sector_transformations.evidence_summary: v3-7 deep dive: 2.39M workers, most fragmented major sector (488K establishments, avg 4.9 workers). PRIMARY SECOND-ORDER CASCADE RECEPTOR: FS meltdown (CMBS 12.34%), remote work, AI workforce reduction all converge simultaneously. $936B debt maturity wall in 2026, office values 35-50% below 2020 peaks. NAR settlement + AI agents = existential pressure on 453K brokers (138K offices avg 3.3 workers). Baumol 1.03x = NOT a wage cure target, but STRUCTURAL fragmentation + cascade exposure.

sector_transformations.sector_name: Securities, Commodity Contracts, and Financial Investments
sector_transformations.evidence_summary: v3-7 deep dive: 1.07M workers, $287B payroll, Baumol 3.71x (highest of any deep-dived sector). KEY DIVERGENCE: wages DECLINING (-2.4%) while employment GROWS (+4.1%) = structural shift from high-comp traders/analysts to lower-cost AI-augmented ops. Portfolio management (523940): 496K workers, 85K establishments avg 5.8 workers = classic rollup territory. RIA M&A record 345 deals ($1.22T transacted). 38% of advisors plan to retire within decade. Entry-level analyst hiring declining 24pp. Firms automating 60-70% of junior analyst tasks.

v3-8 DEEP DIVE (first ever): 15.53M workers = largest private employer, 1.07M establishments, Baumol 0.57 (LOW stored energy but MASSIVE absolute scale). Near-zero employment growth (+0.3%) while establishments grow (+1.3%) = fragmentation. Bifurcating: e-commerce 16-18% of sales growing vs physical retail 800+ closures in 2026. Retail media networks $69B new profit layer. Self-checkout 87% consumer adoption, cashierless 13.7% CAGR. Warehouse automation $181B by 2031. 3 STRUCTURAL_WINNERs in top 11 overall. Labor displacement concentrates on entry-level, young, female, minority workers = most politically sensitive displacement in economy.

v3-8: Motor vehicle dealers (441) showing wages DECLINING -2.4% while employment grows +1.2% — potential Inverse Baumol signal within retail. Building materials (444) showing employment declining -1.4% with wages rising +2.9% (classic contraction). Retail overall: wages +1.7%, employment +0.3% = near-stagnation. Low Baumol score (0.57) means the Inverse Baumol mechanism operates differently here — not wage premium compression but absolute wage suppression through automation of bottom-tier roles.

v3-9 DEEP DIVE (first emerging category dive): 33.9M addressable entities (30.4M nonemployers + 3.5M micro-employers). Coasean firm shrinkage confirmed: nonemployers +84% since 1997, 478K/month new business applications, avg firm size declining. Micro-firm taxonomy: Tier 1 (solo+AI, ~$500K-2M rev), Tier 2 (2-3 humans+AI, ~$2M-10M), Tier 3 (4-5 humans+AI, ~$5M-25M). Revenue per employee at AI-native companies 6x traditional SaaS ($3.48M vs $570K). Infrastructure stack 52% solved by point solutions, 48% gap = the opportunity. 10 model cards including AI OS (#1 actionable at 84.17 geo mean), Solopreneur Assistant (#3 actionable at 81.64), AI Accountant (80.5 transformation). 6 WIDE_OPEN, 4 ACCESSIBLE. First proper definition of emerging firm structure.

fear_friction_index.notes: Legal sub-sector at 82% ethical concern is highest of any professional field

v3-9 deep dive confirms: LOW friction. Manufacturing transformation is ADDITIVE not substitutional — cobots augment workers who don't exist (499K shortage). Owner reluctance is about RETIREMENT not AI fear. Worker friction near zero (cobots do dangerous/repetitive tasks). 78-point implementation gap is capability not psychology.

v3-8 deep dive: 34-pt provider-patient trust gap confirmed. 71% hospitals deployed predictive AI but via invisible pathway (admin, not clinical). FDA deregulation widens gap: economic readiness up but patients unaware. Healthcare AI creating NEW roles (data analysts, AI trainers) — friction may prolong transition rather than prevent it
UPGRADED to gap=0 (from 1). Defense tech exits > investment = market validated. Fear runs OPPOSITE: fear of NOT adopting AI while adversaries do.
CONFIRMED by Brookings 50-country study. Ohio mandates, Michigan chatbot liability. Entry sequence: corporate (gap 2) → teacher-facing (gap 2) → university admin (gap 3) → student-facing (gap 6).
NEW (v3-6). Sector screener candidate #1. Internally bifurcating — AI infra grows while content creation contracts. Workers ARE the AI adopters so friction is low.
NEW (v3-6). Sector screener candidate #4. AI readiness limited by legacy grid infrastructure, not psychology.
NEW (v3-7). Workers ARE the AI builders/adopters. Low friction but self-disruption paradox: the sector building AI is most disrupted by it. 84% daily AI coding usage.
NEW (v3-7). Middle management resistance to AI that replaces coordination function. 60% anticipatory displacement but executives view AI as cost reduction tool, not threat to own role.
NEW (v3-7). NAR settlement already disrupting commission model. Agent resistance to AI intermediation high but fragmentation (4.9 workers/establishment) means no collective bargaining power.
NEW (v3-7). Wall Street culture embraces automation that increases alpha. Entry-level resistance irrelevant (firms automate regardless). RIA rollup consolidation accelerates adoption.

NEW (v3-8). Consumer-side friction LOW (87% use self-checkout, cashierless accepted). Worker-side friction MODERATE but powerless (fragmented, non-unionized, high turnover masks displacement). Political friction HIGH (displacement concentrates on young, female, minority workers). Gap of 1 understates political sensitivity.

NEW (v3-9). Economic readiness high (AI agents demonstrably capable, costs viable). Psychological barriers: Bench shutdown cautionary tale, trust for financial/legal AI guidance unproven at scale, solo practitioners habituated to manual processes. Gap narrows rapidly as Gen Z/Millennial founders adopt.

cla_system.name: Competitive Landscape Assessment
cla_system.purpose: Independent second ranking measuring entrant opportunity (vs 5-axis transformation certainty)
cla_system.scoring_method: Manual overrides for 87 models (49 original + 38 v3-9 refinements) + heuristic engine for remaining 348
cla_system.dual_ranking_principle: Transformation Rank and Opportunity Rank are NEVER merged into a single number

top_5_actionable.name: Micro-Firm AI OS — SMB Growth Tier

cla_system.key_insight: v3-9 Opportunity First: 4 of top 5 actionable models are now from opportunity-first sectors (micro-firm + manufacturing). CLA refinement lowered 31 mid-tier models, confirming heuristic systematically overscored wholesale, education, and capital-market A&M models.

new_cards_v39.note: 22 new model cards from 2 deep dives (12 manufacturing + 10 micro-firm) + 38 CLA manual overrides for mid-tier models (413→435)

F2_demographics.status: APPROACHING — currently at 67% junior dev decline

F5_psychology.status: APPROACHING — 60% expect net job losses (from 40% in v3-4)

running_patterns.description: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure: Healthcare, legal, accounting, insurance, education releasing stored above-CPI energy
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Defines the transformation path for NAICS 52, 54, 61, 62 — routine cognitive middle collapses, judgment premium rises

running_patterns.description: Silver Tsunami: $68T total wealth transfer including $5.1T small business value, 12M businesses changing hands, 58% no succession
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Scale upgraded v3-6: $68T total transfer (was $10T business assets). Employee ownership models emerging as succession alternative.

running_patterns.description: Robotics × AI Compound: China wins volume race (90% humanoid market, Unitree 5,500, AgiBot 5,168). Cobots $25-60K, 6-18mo ROI.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: China's humanoid robot dominance shifts narrative from US-led to China-led physical AI. Tesla Optimus no useful work yet despite mass production launch.

running_patterns.description: Physical Architecture Dominance: physical sectors outperforming digital in durability scoring
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Capital rotation to physical/industrial is structural, not cyclical

running_patterns.description: Zero-Density Schumpeterian Gaps: wholesale, printing, food — zero AI startups despite strong forces
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Identifies sectors where transformation will be SUDDEN when it starts — no gradual adoption curve

running_patterns.description: Financial Services Cascade DEEPENED: Office CMBS 12.34% all-time record (above 2008). CRE cascade validated. $800B-$1.2T value reallocation.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: FS cascade now has CRE validation — office CMBS WORSE than 2008 Financial Crisis. Second-order effects to real estate and regional banking confirmed.

running_patterns.description: Staffing Canary: RHI -53%, MAN -44%, KELYA -25% — entry-level collapse (-67% junior devs) deepens signal
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Administrative services + entry-level employment in structural collapse

running_patterns.description: Global AI Ecosystem Trifurcation: US proprietary/subscription vs China open-source/free-access vs Gulf neutral compute hub
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Updated v3-6: Gulf ($200B+) positioning as NEUTRAL third node. India ($70-100B+, zero-tax-through-2047) emerging as fourth compute center.

running_patterns.description: Reshoring Reality Gap: Record capital but 2-5 year investment-to-production lag
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Manufacturing models must account for 2-5 year lag between capital commitment and operational output.

running_patterns.description: Defense AI Supercycle DEPLOYED: $2,750B+ global defense. Exits ($54.4B) > investment ($49.1B) = first AI sector in Deployment phase. ReArm Europe EUR 800B.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: UPGRADED v3-6. Defense is the first AI sector where Deployment-phase capital dynamics are visible. Exits exceeding investment confirms market maturity.

running_patterns.description: Gulf Oil-to-AI Conversion: $200B+ combined Saudi/UAE. HUMAIN 18K GB300s. UAE Stargate 1GW. Neutral compute hub positioning.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: UPGRADED v3-6: commitments scaled to $200B+. Neutral third node strategy between US-China explicit.

running_patterns.description: Healthcare Invisible AI Pathway: FDA deregulated AI CDS (Jan 6, 2026). Physician-tool adoption (66%). Trust barrier circumvented, not overcome.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: UPGRADED v3-6: FDA deregulation qualitatively shifts the adoption path. AI CDS software exempt from device regulation.

running_patterns.description: Education Fear Friction Maximum: Brookings 50-country study confirms. Ohio mandates, Michigan chatbot liability. Gap=5 holds.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: v3-6 crystallized with first academic evidence (Brookings), state mandates (Ohio), and liability proposals (Michigan). Fear creates $5-10B governance sub-market.

running_patterns.description: Defense Regulatory Moat Cascade: CMMC + FedRAMP + ITAR + ATO + clearance. 220K DIB companies must certify. Top card MC-DEF-011 at 82.5.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: v3-6: CMMC card scored highest of all 32 new cards (82.5). Regulatory moat thesis confirmed by scoring data.

running_patterns.description: Education Baumol Cure Sequencing: Corporate→teacher tools→university admin→K-12 tutoring (gap 2→2→3→6).
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: v3-6: 8 education cards scored, confirming sequence. Corporate (74.5) > Teacher (72.25) > University (67.5) > K-12 Tutoring (62.25).

running_patterns.description: Anticipatory Displacement: 60% of companies cut headcount for AI potential not performance. 108K Jan 2026 layoffs (+118% YoY). HBR/Oxford Economics confirm firms NOT replacing workers with AI at scale. Fear-driven self-fulfilling prophecy.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: NEW (v3-6). Companies and workers BOTH acting on AI fear. Corporate anticipatory displacement (60%) + worker fear (60%) creates bilateral feedback loop. Actual AI-driven layoffs remain ~4.5% but narrative-driven displacement is structural.

running_patterns.description: Entry-Level Extinction: 67% junior dev collapse, 35% all entry-level decline, 37% managers prefer AI over Gen Z. Pipeline destruction with decade-lag leadership consequences.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: NEW (v3-6). The apprenticeship function of entry-level work has no AI substitute. 67% fewer potential leaders in 2031-2036. This creates a LONG-TERM human capital formation crisis across all sectors.

running_patterns.description: AI Infrastructure Chain Constraint: NVIDIA $500B backlog → IEA 945 TWh by 2030 → PJM $16.4B capacity auction → copper 766K deficit by 2030 → water stress 1.7B gal/day. Each layer of Jevons cascade constrains the layer above.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: NEW (v3-6). AI scaling constrained by multi-layer physical resource chain. Compute demand → energy demand → grid capacity → raw materials → water. The slowest link determines overall AI scaling velocity. Data center occupancy 95%+ by late 2026 = physical capacity crisis.

running_patterns.description: Healthcare Employment Monoculture: 95% of Jan 2026 net job creation (137K of 143K). Trailing 3-month: 54.1% of all private jobs. One sector masking structural weakness in every other sector.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: NEW (v3-7). Headline jobs numbers are masking economy-wide restructuring. Healthcare policy changes (Medicaid, Medicare) have outsized employment impact when one sector = 95% of job creation. Every other sector is net zero or negative.

running_patterns.description: Inverse Baumol Effect (Cross-Sector): Wages declining while employment grows — AI compresses wage premium in knowledge work. CONFIRMED in Securities (-2.4% wages, +4.1% employment). CONVERGING in Accounting (wage growth collapsed 56% in one year: +6.6%→+2.9%). Pre-disruption in Legal (employment stalling at +0.5%). Classic growth in Insurance (2-3 years behind). Fear friction is primary timing predictor: flip_delay ≈ fear_friction_score / 20.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: UPGRADED v3-8: Cross-sector test confirms P-040 is not Securities-specific. Accounting convergence is most significant finding (56% wage growth deceleration in one year). Coasean shrinkage (establishment growth > employment growth) identified as leading indicator. Entry-level extinction is the mechanism: AI automates junior tasks, firms add lower-cost AI-augmented roles. Predicted flip sequence: Securities (done) → Accounting (2025-2026) → Legal (2027-2028) → Insurance (2028-2029). Falsification: if 2024 QCEW shows Accounting wage growth re-accelerating, pattern is not structural.

running_patterns.description: Manufacturing Modernization Bimodality: top 1% of manufacturers AI-sophisticated (digital twins, predictive, vision QC), bottom 72% still on spreadsheets/paper. 78-point implementation gap (98% exploring, 20% ready). Bimodal distribution, not bell curve.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: NEW (v3-9). The gap between AI-ready and AI-absent in manufacturing is the largest of any sector. This creates massive acquire-and-modernize opportunity — buy spreadsheet-era shops, deploy proven cobot+AI stack. The bimodality will resolve over 5-7 years as modernizers acquire holdouts. 75% of A&M manufacturing models are WIDE_OPEN.

key_unknowns: FS cascade: slow burn or acute stress? Counter-signals show banks passing stress tests ($550B absorbed, $52B CRE), office absorption turned positive (first since 2019), vacancy declining. But CMBS still at record and $936B maturity wall in 2026. Timeline may be 4-6 years not 2-3.

IT Services: compositional transformation or absolute decline? Counter-signals: 1.1M tech postings, 61% leaders plan increases, new categories (AIOps $66.8B by 2032) growing 100%+. Engine projection (26.8% decline by 2031) may confuse role transformation with elimination.
METR 19% slower: learning curve or fundamental limit? Only 16 devs, 56% never used Cursor. Faros AI (10K+ devs) shows opposite pattern. Critical input to IT Services projections.

Healthcare monoculture: fragile or structurally sustainable? Counter-signal: 95% seniors have 1+ chronic condition, 20% GDP, BLS projects 1.8M new jobs/year. May be appropriate demographic response not bubble. But nursing 8% deficit = can't fill its own demand.
Inverse Baumol (P-040) confirmation: Accounting convergence most significant finding (56% wage deceleration in one year). 2024 QCEW data (~Q3 2026) will confirm or falsify cross-sector pattern.
Retail political sensitivity: 15.5M workers, displacement concentrates on young/female/minority. Will political response (minimum wage, automation taxes) slow transformation?
Gartner Trough of Disillusionment: GenAI declared in trough (Feb 2026). Does this mean deployment delays or rationalization that accelerates sustainable adoption?
DOGE federal workforce cuts (-212K, -9%): Temporary disruption or permanent government downsizing? Recalls of fired workers suggest overcutting. DC/VA/MD regional restructuring.
Perez crash timing: Capital still accelerating ($140B+ frontier raises). Gartner trough may be hype correction not investment correction. Crash may be 2028-2029, not 2026-2027.
Office CMBS vs fundamentals divergence: CMBS delinquency at record but office absorption positive, vacancy declining. Which signal is right?
Entry-level extinction permanence: Is 67% junior dev collapse cyclical or structural? If structural, leadership pipeline crisis by 2031.
Deepfake trust collapse: Europol 90% synthetic content projection. Liar's Dividend creating permanent trust destruction?

Manufacturing Modernization Bimodality (P-041): Is the 78-point implementation gap (98% exploring, 20% ready) closing or widening? If closing, first-mover advantage narrows for acquire-and-modernize plays.

Micro-firm vs point solution: Will integrated AI OS win or will best-in-class point solutions (QuickBooks + Gusto + HubSpot stack) prove sufficient? Bench shutdown = cautionary tale for full-stack approach.
Physical constraints binding AI: 15 GW leased but 0 online. Copper at $13,387 record. 2,600 GW queue. Does this slow AI deployment velocity enough to extend transformation timelines by 1-2 years?
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Wholesale Trade deep dive (NAICS 42) — Zero-density Schumpeterian gap persists (P-022). High opportunity, low transformation coverage. CLA refinement found heuristic overscores this sector. 38 overrides exposed systematic bias.

PRIORITY 2: Transportation & Warehousing deep dive (NAICS 48-49) — 6.5M workers, autonomous vehicles + drone delivery + AI logistics. Natural extension of Retail (last-mile) and Manufacturing (supply chain) deep dives.

PRIORITY 3: Re-examine PARKED models with WIDE_OPEN/ACCESSIBLE opportunity — self-reflection identified 29 PARKED models with high opportunity scores. These may be the most practical opportunities (lower conviction but wide open).
PRIORITY 4: 2024 QCEW data release (expected ~Q3 2026) — CRITICAL for P-040 Inverse Baumol confirmation across Securities, Accounting, Legal, Insurance.
PRIORITY 5: Arts/Entertainment deep dive (NAICS 71) — deferred from v3-8. Deepfake/synthetic content + streaming economics + live experience premium.

PRIORITY 6: Manufacturing sub-sector 6-digit expansion — v3-9 deep dive at 4-digit level. Machine shops (332710), auto parts (336390), food manufacturing (311xxx) warrant 6-digit analysis for more precise opportunity mapping.

PRIORITY 7: Micro-firm infrastructure competition tracking — Intuit QuickBooks AI expansion, Mercury banking, point solution consolidation. The AI OS vs best-in-class battle resolves within 18 months.
PRIORITY 8: CLA manual override expansion — self-reflection directed 100+ overrides (up from 87). Prioritize mid-tier T#50-150 where heuristic is least reliable.
